author: Alexandra Wolfe
title: ‘Art of the Airport Tower’
text:
Photographer and Smithsonian curator Carolyn Russo was looking out the window at LaGuardia Airport when a thought struck her: The control tower looked like Swiss cheese. She soon started photographing other towers around the world, fascinated by their shapes. Those images are the subject of a traveling Smithsonian exhibition, “Art of the Airport Tower,” now at the Aerospace Museum of California in McClellan, Calif., through July 6. The towers are “these unsung heroes in the aviation environment,” she says.
